p: It is a polyherbal Ayurvedic formulation that contains Bacopa monneri (40% w/ w), Evolvulus alsinoids (20% w/ w), Acorus calamus (20% w/ w), Saussurea lappa (20% w/ w) and cowâ€™s ghee (750 mL). Traditionally, it is used as a memory enhancer [ 258]. Achliya et al. [ 259] evaluated the learning and memory enhancing effect of this formulation at 30, 50 and 100 mg/kg oral doses. The results of this study showed that Bramhi Ghrita at the doses of 50 and 100 mg/kg, p.o decreased the transfer latency in elevated plus maze and escape latency in Morris water maze test. Additionally, it enhanced the learning and memory of rats indicating the nootropic activity [ 260].
